gameutils.gui
Class Label

java.lang.Object
  gameutils.gui.Widget
      gameutils.gui.Label
All Implemented Interfaces:
Element
public class Label
extends Widget

A Label extends Widget and just draws a String. If you are confused with the usage of Paint, remember Color implements Paint so you can still a Color if you wish.

Author:
Roi Atalla

Constructor Detail

Label

public Label(String text,
             Paint paint,
             Font font,
             int x,
             int y,
             boolean centered)
Initializes this object. Background is set to transparent.

Parameters:
text - The text to show. If this is null, an empty string is set.
paint - The Paint of the text. If this is null, the Paint is set to Color.black.
font - The font of the text. If this is null, it uses a Bold Sans Serif with a point size of 20.
x - The X position of the text.
y - The Y position of the text.
centered - If true, the X and Y are the center of the text, else they are the top left corner of the text.

Label

public Label(String text,
             Paint paint,
             int fontSize,
             int x,
             int y,
             boolean centered)
Initializes this object.

Parameters:
text - The text to show. If this is null, an empty string is set.
paint - The Paint of the text. If this is null, the Paint is set to Color.black.
fontSize - The font size of the text. The default font is a Bold Sans Serif.
x - The X position of the text.
y - The Y position of the text.
centered - If true, the X and Y are the center of the text, else they are the top left corner of the text.

Label

public Label(String text,
             int fontSize,
             int x,
             int y,
             boolean centered)
Initializes this object.

Parameters:
text - The text to show. If this is null, an empty string is set. The default color is black.
fontSize - The font size of the text. The default font is a Bold Sans-Serif.
x - The X position of the text.
y - The Y position of the text.
centered - If true, the X and Y are the center of the text, else they are the top left corner of the text.

getText

public String getText()
Returns the text that is shown.

Returns:
The text that is shown.

setText

public void setText(String text)
Sets the text to show. If the current text is the same as the description, the description is set the specified text, else the desription is untouched.

Parameters:
text - The new text to show.
